messages.message: I thinkkkkk the source of this bug is here but I can't trace it further than this or confirm: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/master/webserver/api-server/src/py/instabase/handler/api/v1/drive.py#L558

But it happens consistently when copying across repos, I can't see any difference in the call I'm making between the two cases, and there's a special case in this code for what to do when copying across repos
@Heymian would this be within your domain?

@Jessica could you create an Asana task out of it to make it easier to follow all the discussions? Also: if you could send the request that is coming from the frontend (when copying a folder repo to same repo) vs (when copying a folder from one repo to another repo) could help debug more once i see those
